alert.note: Alert for Grand (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 28 at 2:51PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM MDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of Grand County, including the East Troublesome burn scar. * WHEN...Until 600 PM MDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 249 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated areas of heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This may cause small stream flooding. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.5 inches will be possible over the area. This additional rain may result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... East Troublesome burn scar. - This includes the following additional locations... Middle Willow Creek Valley, Lower Willow Creek Valley, Drowsy Water Ranch, Elk Mountain, Remote East Troublesome Headwaters, East Troublesome Valley and Upper Corral Creek Valley.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Heavy Rainfall may cause minor flooding of small creeks, streams, and ditches in the East Troublesome burn area. The heavy rains could also trigger rock slides or debris flows.
